text:
Seems that you don’t have a css rule for the html tag. This happens if the content isn’t longer than the browser window. 

You could make the html background color match. 

The other option is to make it so that the body container has a min-height of 100vh

Hey guys. Has anyone used AB Tasty along with Drupal + HubSpot data before? Looking into what's possible with using HS's cookies to run some AB tasty tests. EX: Could I pick up a through a cookie if a visitor is a returning visitor, a new visitor, their lifecycle stage, etc?

never done with AB Tasty, but `__hstc` is the cookie that stores the first visit and last visit of user, and the session numbers.

you can get more information here - <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/reports/what-cookies-does-HubSpot-set-in-a-visitor-s-browser>

<@UP452DA2Z>

Cheers <@UCH1L597V>, thought so. I'd chucked that link over to the team asking about it yesterday.

There seems to be a notion that other CRMs can expose more than just first/last/sessions through a cookie. Definitely arguments that this could be risky from a DP standpoint, however the guys still want to start personalising website experience based on things like lifecycle stage, deal stage, etc...

If only we used HS CMS ;)

Hello.

If I have a HubSpot CMS website setup with a brand domain, and I also have a separate web-app hosted on say Amazon Web Services at <http://app.brandDomain.com|app.brandDomain.com> , do I need to do anything except add the tracking code to the web-app to have it successfully capture analytics in which a view could be segmented for either <http://brandDomain.com|brandDomain.com> or <http://app.brandDomain.com|app.brandDomain.com> inside HubSpot?
is it possible to use HubL in a javascript file??
What do you want to use HubL in a JavaScript file for?

Hi everybody! I was recommended to join the Slack community by HubSpot customer support as apparently, I have a use case that goes outside the scope of tools provided by HS. I hope I can find some help here:-)

I would like to have a Knowledge Base that is only visible to the users of my platform, meaning that the KB should be "public" for logged in users. Any suggestion on how to make this happen using HubSpot KB?
Hi where can I find or join HubSpot developer webinar?
